title: (x) Sea Cliff Country Club logo - Centaur (mangled) {Yves}
content:
Please help me ID the font used in this logo.

Thank you.

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [seacliff.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20060604052211/http:/typophile.com/files/seacliff.jpg) | 24.56 KB |
author: evan

comments.content: This looks like a poor man’s version of [Centaur](http://web.archive.org/web/20060604052211/http:/www.fontshop.com/index.cfm?fuseaction=catalog.fontdetail&displayfontid=M.736.0.1&attributes.sampleSize=48&sampleText=SEA+CLIFF+COUNTRY+CLUB&sampleSize=24).
Thanks so much - looks close enough to me, only a type expert would notice the difference.

But most anybody can **feel** the difference.

hhp

It’s funny you say that. Often I have the impression that I identify certain typefaces that are available in numerous variations (like one of the many Garamonds for example) because they _feel_ a certain way. It’s almost an unconscious thing.

_Could it be I’m channeled by a higher power? By the Great Type Identifier in the sky? Or is it just the drugs?:-D_
